children.name: Doc Types

ZZC Prscrbs/CareP
of statin user
in follow up
children.NodeDescription:
////clue
[to do]
1. Get all docs in service claims, and in drug claims for the statin cohort, within the follow up period
2. For each entryDate specific doctor, determine their type (GP or NGP)
////

children.name:
ZZA entryDates
specific docs
ZZA1 patient-entrydate
children.NodeDescription:
////clue
From vxa (the statin cohort), get all distinct patient-entrydates. 
[_Note] such dates will be used to prepare a list of prescribers and service providers to these patients within the followup period (i.e.365 days since the EntryDate)
////

children.name:
ZZA2 Statin PRs
during followup
children.NodeDescription:
/*ZZA2. For statin new users (zza1), find statin prescribers within the followup period (365 days since the entryDate)*/
/*ZZA2a. Get all statin claims within follow up*/
%VbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localTargetPath.\vxf.zip),
    srcFile=%str(vxf.sas7bdat)
);
/*%print(data=vxf);*/
/*ZZA2b. get a list of entryDate specific doc ID, excluding those of unknown ids or slush numbers*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=vxf,
    t2=zza1,
    target=zza2,
    vars=%str(t1.key_prscr_num as key_doc_num, t2.entryDate),
    distinct=1,
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=key_hsn,
    filters=%str(rx_ddddd between t2.Entrydate and t2.EntryDate +364 and docSlushCode = 'N')
);

children.name:
ZZA3 Care Providers
during follow up
children.NodeDescription:
/*ZZA3. For statin new users (zza1), find physician service providers within the followup period (365 days since the entryDate)*/
/*ZZA3a. Get all service claims of the new statin users within follow up*/
%VbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_msb.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_msb.sas7bdat)
);
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_msb,
    t2=zza1,
    target=zza3,
    vars=%str(t1.key_doc_num, t2.entryDate),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=key_hsn,
    filters=%str(dos between t2.Entrydate and t2.EntryDate +364 and docSlushCode = 'N')
);

children.name:
ZZA4 combine
ZZA2 ZZA3
children.NodeDescription:
/*ZZA4. combine ZZA2 and ZZA3 (docs as prescribers/care providers during follow up , specified by entry date)*/
data ZZA4a;
    set zza2 ;
    Role = 'prescriber';
run;
data ZZA4b;
    set ZZa3;
    Role='careprovider';
run;
data ZZA4;
    set ZZA4a ZZA4b;
    cnt=1;
run;
%DISTINCT(data=ZZA4, target=ZZA5, vars=%str(key_doc_num, entrydate, Role, cnt));
%transpose(data=ZZA5, target=ZZA6, rowhead=key_doc_num entrydate, colhead=role, contents=cnt);
data localt.ZZA;
    set ZZA6;
    format Role $20.;
    if prescriber=1 and careprovid=1 then Role='both';
    if prescriber=1 and careprovid=. then Role='prescriber';
    if prescriber=. and careprovid=1 then Role='careprovider';
    if prescriber=. and careprovid=. then Role='none';
    drop prescriber careprovid;
run;
%freq(data=localt.zza, table=Role);

children.name:
ZZB MSB Claims
of docs in ZZA
children.NodeDescription:
/*
ZZB MSB claims of docs in ZZA
*/
data _null_;run;
%nobs(data=remotes.zza);
%distinct(data=remotes.zza, target=zzb1, vars=key_doc_num);

/*create an empty dataset*/

%macro getMSB(theYear=, theStart=, theEnd=, debug=);
        %local theYear theStart theEnd debug;
        %Extract_MSB(
                    xtrc_start_dt=&Xtrc_Start_MSB,
                    xtrc_end_dt=&Xtrc_End_MSB,
                    ds_out=getMSB_tmp1,
                    hsn_list=,
                    hsn_file= ,
                    diagcode=,
                    dostart=&theStart,
                    dosend=&theEnd,
                    fscode=
        );

        %sqljoinv2(
            t1=getMSB_tmp1,
            t2=zzb1,
            vars=t1.*,
            target=%str(getMSB_tmp2 (rename =(dos_1 = DOS))),
            jtype=inner,
            jvars=key_doc_num
        );

        %if &theYear = 2009 %then %do;
            data msbzzb;
                set getMSB_tmp2;
            run;
        %end;
        %else %do;
            data msbzzb;
                set msbzzb getMSB_tmp2;
            run;
        %end;

        %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
            proc datasets nolist;
                delete getMSB_tmp:;
            run;
        %end;

%mend getMSB;
%getMSB(theYear=2009, theStart='01jan2009'd, theEnd='31dec2017'd, debug=1);

%UnixZip(
    sPath=,
    source=,
    data=msbzzb,
    tPath=&remoteTargetPath,
    target=msbzzb.zip,
    debug=
);

children.name: ZZC GPs

ZZC1
entryDate-specific
docs by SPEC
from ZZB
children.NodeDescription:
/*ZZC1, get a unique list of entrydate specific docs by SPEC from the MSB claims
    within 2 year before and 1 year after the entryDate*/
/*the following is very inefficient, so prepare a compact data set first*/
%distinct(data=msbzzb, target=ZZC0, vars=%str(key_doc_num, dos, SPEC));
        /*how many doctors acting as GP, NGP, missing on the same date*/
            data test1;
                set zzc0;
                format Doctype $3.;
                if SPEC in: ("B") then DocType = "GP";
                if SPEC ="" then DocType = "NN";
                if SPEC not in:("B") and SPEC ne "" then DocType="NGP";
                cnt=1;
            run;
            %sqljoinv2(
                t1=test1,
                target=test2,
                vars=%str(t1.key_doc_num, t1.dos, sum(Doctype="GP") as GP, sum(Doctype="NN") as NN,
                                sum(Doctype="NGP") as NGP
                                ),
                groupby=%str(key_doc_num, dos)
            );
            /*check the patterns*/
            data test3;
                set test2;
                if GP =0 then p1="";else P1="G";
                if NGP=0 then p2="";else p2="N";
                if NN=0 then p3="";else p3="_";
                DocPattern=cats(p1,p2,p3);
                drop p1 p2 p3;
            run;
            %freq(data=test3, table=docPattern);
            /*it is quite rare that a doc was acting as both GP and NGP on the same date*/



%sqljoinv2(
    t1=zzc0,
    t2=localt.ZZA,
    target=zzc1,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.key_doc_num, t2.entryDate, SPEC,
                        ifn(
                                substr(strip(SPEC), 1,1)="B", 1, 2   
                            ) as order
                    ),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=key_doc_num,
    orderby = %str(key_doc_num,entryDate, order),
    filters=%str(t1.dos between t2.entryDate - 365*2 and t2.entryDate+365-1)
);
/*%freq(data=zzc1, table=spec);*/
/*Note: there are records missing SPEC values*/
                        /*Aummarized by specific study periods (2 years before and 1 year after entryDate), how is the doc pattern?
                        */
                        data test1;
                            set zzc1;
                            format Doctype $3.;
                            if SPEC in: ("B") then DocType = "GP";
                            if SPEC ="" then DocType = "NN";
                            if SPEC not in:("B") and SPEC ne "" then DocType="NGP";
                            cnt=1;
                        run;
                        %sqljoinv2(
                            t1=test1,
                            target=test2,
                            vars=%str(t1.key_doc_num, t1.entryDate, sum(Doctype="GP") as GP, sum(Doctype="NN") as NN,
                                            sum(Doctype="NGP") as NGP
                                            ),
                            groupby=%str(key_doc_num, entryDate)
                        );
                        /*check the patterns*/
                        data test3;
                            set test2;
                            if GP =0 then p1="";else P1="G";
                            if NGP=0 then p2="";else p2="N";
                            if NN=0 then p3="";else p3="_";
                            DocPattern=cats(p1,p2,p3);
                            drop p1 p2 p3;
                        run;
                        %freq(data=test3, table=docPattern);
                        /*Again, it is quite rare that a doc was acting as both GP and NGP on the same date
                        */

/*It seems OK to be more restrict, as there is not a lot of hybrid docs to lose.
The decision is to indicate docs as NGP if there is at lease 1 claim as NGP
That way, the remaining docs only have GP claims. These docs are pure GPs.
*/

ZZC is to determine (using data in ZZB) whether the physician is a GP

children.name:
ZZE
Missing MSB
before Rx
children.NodeDescription:
////clue 
[to do]
does the paytype (NFFS/FFS) predicts the missing msb claims within 30,60,90,180,360 days prior to the statin Rx
1. logistic regression (20% to 50% missing as cut off), repeated by patient (outcome = yes/no missing, vars = paytype, repeated = patient doc
2. poisson model (% of missing cases by NFFS/FFS paytype), repeated by patient
////

children.name:
ZZE2 logistic
paytype on
patient missing claim

ZZE2b Rx in ZZE1
indicating missing
claim in 30/60/90/180 days

ZZE2C
GEE model
children.NodeDescription:
////clue
[to do]
It is a cross over...
Rx1 patient 1, Doc A, missing claim =1
Rx2 patient 1, Doc A, missing claim =0
Rx3 Patient 1, Doc A, missing claim =1
Rx4 patient 1, Doc B, missing claim =1
Rx5 patient 1, Doc B, missing claim =0
Rx6 Patient 2, Doc A, missing claim =1
Rx7 patient 2, Doc C, missing claim =1
...
Doc and patient are not nested levels. Instead, there are lots of crossovers. But the crossover is not complete. 

What would be the most appropriate statistical method to use? 

The empirical analysis should yield the same OR point of estimation as the model-based analysis (only that the 95%CI is different). But in this analysis, it seems that the point of estimate are different. Why?
////

children.name:
ZZE3 GEE PayType on
Doc Cat by Y% of
patients missing claims

ZZE3c
GEE models
children.NodeDescription:
////clue
[to do]
Two cutting off terms are to be determined here.
1. How many days to look back for a missing claim. e.g., the statin fill date is Dec-31-2012, shall we look back for 30 days for whether there is a physician service claim by the prescriber? or 60, 90, 180 days?
2. What is the cut-off to define a patient of missing claims. e.g., if 80% of the patient's fills cannot find a prior service claim, the patient is defined as of missing claim patient. 
 
The result is quite strange, especially with different cut-off of % of missing claims. When set the missing % cutting off from 0% to 100%, the OR of having a patient classed as missing claims (having y% claims missing) changes. The OR is not stable. Why?
////

children.name:
ZZE4 Poisson
PayType on Missing Rate

////clue

How to check if the data follows Poisson distribution

Analysis by doc

FFS and NFFS
GEE BIN Model
children.NodeDescription:
////clue
[to do]
Does it make sense?
It is a GEE Binary analysis
On whether or not being the USUAL GP in follow up (UGPF)
by paytype(NFFS/FFS/Unknown)
Repeated by patient
stratified by key_doc_num (being both NFFS FFS)

In Proc GenMod,
What is the statement Strata for? Seems in this analysis, it does not change the results

The result is quite weird, and difficult to explain, the OR > 1
////

children.name: GEE POI Model
children.NodeDescription:
////clue
[to do]
The results are even stranger. It is the kind of before-after analysis (docs were FFS, then turned to NFFS). Those turned to NFFS are more likely to be UGPF! Opposite to the hypothesis. 

////

children.name: Multivariate models
children.NodeDescription:
////clue
[to do]
It seems that NFFS/FFS do not have diff impact on adherence. So why changing the pay mode?
Politically it might be just to save cost, and 'spending more time with patients' is just an excuse. 
If the adherence is not improved,
How about the number of patients per doc (does it reduced among NFFS? which might suggest that NFFS spent more time with each doc)
Does the cost being reduced (A FFS doc cost more on physician services per patient than a NFFS (who is paid by fixed amount)). 
////
